Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. The shooting budget was very cheap and the overall movie is not meant to be intense or full of confetti-drop level special effects. But Lord of the Rings would have looked amateurish if all the greenscreen work hadn't been completed in a special room apart from the actual shooting, and here you get directorial care and control.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Taryn Simon is an artist who uses knowledge and information to create startling and thought-provoking works. Her workshops with approximately 20 internees illuminates the intersections where art, science, poetry and storytelling can create rich reflections on what we think we know about the world in a new light.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was originally a novel that was initially republished as a film script. The film won the César Award for Best French Film in 1976.
